title: Is my computer safe without any firewall software installed on it? - Quora

Mostly safe. Windows firewall has a large number of application-specific inbound and outbound rules, which prevent arbitrary programs from accessing the internet. Every single application which you install, pretty much, punches holes in the firewall so that it will work. You granted it that access when you typed an admin password during the install process. So if you don’t have a webserver installed, the firewall blocks access to it. If you do, there is a hole in the firewall, opening you up to application-specific attacks against wordpress etc. The firewall comes by default with a lot of holes for software you’ve never heard of and have no intention of running - there’s one called “Microsoft.BingHealthandFitness” for instance, allowing that app access to any address or port on the internet. Anyone writing malware for windows is going to assume that the firewall is running, and will either bypass it somehow or trick you into giving it access. If you get malware sent to you as an email attachment, a firewall will not help since your email program is permitted to contact email servers. Firewalls do have their place. If you have some ancient device like a webcam that uses ftp to upload files to your computer, and it can’t use a password, or uses a fixed one that’s well-known, you need a firewall (or some kind of access control) to make sure that only that device can talk to your ftp server, so that random people on the net don’t use your computer to store warez. But most people don’t do that - they sit behind NAT and don’t run servers; the only way malware gets on their computer is if they installed it by clicking on something. I’m not saying turn off Windows firewall because it’s useless, I’m saying don’t be complacent and think that it will protect you.
